snippet: Iran’s powerful influence in Iraq has been on display as the fight against the Islamic State militants around Tikrit has unfolded, with strong support for Shiite leaders where they were once feared.
abstract: Iran's counteroffensive against Islamic State militants in Iraqi city of Tikrit reveals its growing influence in country; many Iraqi Sunnis who once professed fear and antagonism toward Iran's Shiite leaders now hail them with strong support; conflict has also cast in stark relief the absence of American air support.
lead_paragraph: Iran’s powerful influence in Iraq has been on display as the fight against the Islamic State militants around Tikrit has unfolded, with strong support for Shiite leaders where they were once feared.

headline.main: Iran Gains Influence in Iraq as Shiite Forces Fight ISIS

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
